channel.title: Compiler doesn't read an int? [ALLSTAR, 317]
channel.description: The base I'm using is Allstar. 317 I added this into the void customCommand [code] int uID = inStream.readDWord();[/code] and when I try to use it, I get 2 errors, also most of the place I add it is an "illegal following reference". (obviously readDWord is in stream.java)

item.title: Compiler doesn't read an int? [ALLSTAR, 317]
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

going to bet that’s a local variable to the login block.

item.title: Compiler doesn't read an int? [ALLSTAR, 317]
item.dc:creator: @TheLetterQArousesMe TheLetterQArousesMe
item.description:
@TheLetterQArousesMe wrote:

deathschaos9:

What do you mean when you say you added it into void customCommand?

public void customCommand(String command) {
it has most of the commands in the server. But when I try to compile, even though the int uID is there, it doesn’t recognize it. I’m a noob so I don’t know why it’s not working
also @ lemme_winks_

client.java:12239: cannot find symbol
symbol  :  variable uID
location: class client
if (c.uID != ********) {
     ^
client.java:12240: cannot find symbol
symbol  :  variable uID
location: class client
sendMessage(c.playerName +"'s UID is: "+c.uID+" ");
                                         ^
2 errors
Compiling finished.
Press any key to continue

Read full topic
